coverage_types.description: Most common - all risks except exclusions
Open peril for dwelling and contents

data.intro_content: Protecting your home in California requires understanding local risks and coverage options. With average premiums around $1,200/year and high natural disaster risk including wildfires and earthquakes, finding the right homeowners insurance is essential. Our comprehensive guide helps you understand what's covered, what's not, and how to find the best price for your protection needs.
data.requirements_content: While California doesn't legally require homeowners insurance, your mortgage lender almost certainly does. Even if you own your home outright, insurance protects your largest investment from unexpected disasters, liability claims, and theft. A standard HO-3 policy is the most common, covering your dwelling, personal property, liability, and additional living expenses.

cost_factors.description: High fire zones see 50-100% higher rates
Higher rebuild costs mean higher premiums
Older homes may cost more to insure
Wood frame vs. masonry affects rates

faqs.question: Is earthquake coverage included in standard home insurance?
faqs.answer: No, earthquake coverage requires a separate policy or endorsement in California. The California Earthquake Authority (CEA) offers policies, or you can get coverage from private insurers.

faqs.question: What does standard home insurance cover in California?
faqs.answer: Standard HO-3 policies cover dwelling, personal property, liability, additional living expenses, and other structures. Exclusions include floods, earthquakes, and normal wear and tear.

faqs.question: How much home insurance do I need?
faqs.answer: You need enough coverage to rebuild your home at current construction costs, not just the purchase price. Include coverage for your personal property (typically 50-70% of dwelling coverage) and liability protection.

faqs.question: Does home insurance cover wildfires in California?
faqs.answer: Yes, standard policies cover wildfire damage. However, in high-risk areas, you may face higher premiums, higher deductibles, or difficulty finding coverage. The California FAIR Plan offers coverage of last resort.

additional_coverages.name: Earthquake Insurance
additional_coverages.description: Covers earthquake damage - not included in standard policies
